name: Ema datshi
short_description: Exuding the fiery spirit of Bhutan, this stew blends hot peppers with creamy datshi cheese, onions, tomatoes, and garlic for a bold, comforting experience. A staple that warms both heart and soul!

name: Kewa datshi
short_description: Originating from Bhutan, this hearty stew combines tender potatoes with creamy cheese, vibrant hot peppers, and aromatic garlic. It's a staple comfort food, perfect with rice or puri.

name: Jasha maroo
short_description: A staple of Bhutanese cuisine, tender chicken simmers with aromatic garlic, ginger, and fiery chiles in a savory tomato sauce. Served over red or brown rice, itâ€™s a warm and comforting delight.

name: Phaksha paa
short_description: Dried pork simmers with fiery red chilis, fresh radish, and vibrant spinach in this traditional Bhutanese favorite. Each bite delivers a bold, savory kick that embodies the nation's love for spice.

name: Shamu datshi
short_description: A beloved Bhutanese comfort food, this rich stew features a medley of mushrooms simmered with vibrant hot peppers, tomatoes, and onions. Creamy cheese melts in, adding a delightful finish to each savory spoonful.

name: Datshi
short_description: Originating from Bhutan, this creamy cottage cheese is crafted from cow's or yak's milk, offering a rich, tangy flavor. Perfectly paired with spicy dishes, it brings a delightful balance to every bite.
